required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Pharmacokinetic Single Dose Trial of Empagliflozin in Children and Adolescents With Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus
clinical_study.official_title: An Open-label, Randomised, Multicentre, Single-dose, Parallel Group Trial to Evaluate Pharmacokinetics and Pharmacodynamics of Empagliflozin in Children and Adolescents From 10 to Less Than 18 Years of Age With Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus

oversight_info.authority: Austria: Austrian Medicines and Medical Devices Agency
France: Agence Nationale de Sécurité du Médicament et des produits de santé
Germany: Federal Institute for Drugs and Medical Devices
Israel: Israeli Health Ministry Pharmaceutical Administration
Mexico: Federal Commission for Sanitary Risks Protection
United States: Food and Drug Administration

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of the study is to generate pharmacokinetic and pharmacodynamic data to identify the safe-effective dose of empagliflozin in children and adolescents aged 10 to less than 18 years with type 2 diabetes mellitus.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Pharmacokinetics/Dynamics Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment

primary_outcome.measure: AUC0-infinity (Area under the plasma concentration-time curve from time zero to infinite time)
AUC0-tz (Area under the plasma concentration-time curve from time zero to the the time of the last quantifiable concentration)
tmax (Time of maximum observed plasma concentration)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in urinary glucose excretion
secondary_outcome.time_frame: over 24 hours after study drug intake

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in fasting plasma glucose (mg/dL)
Change from baseline in 8-point plasma glucose profile
secondary_outcome.time_frame: over 24 hours after study drug intake

arm_group.description: Patient to receive a high dose of empagliflozin
Patient to receive a medium dose of empagliflozin
Patient to receive a low dose of empagliflozin

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria:
- Children and adolescents with type 2 diabetes mellitus
- Insufficient glycaemic control (6.5% < HbA1c > 10.5%) despite diet and exercise and/or metformin
- Negative for Islet Cell Antigen and Glutamic Acid Decarboxylase autoantibodies and fasting C-peptide levels >= 0.85 ng/ml
- BMI > 50th percentile for age and sex
Exclusion criteria:
- Uncontrolled hyperglycaemia with a glucose level > 240 mg/dl (> 13.3 mmol/l)
- History of acute metabolic decompensation such as diabetic ketoacidosis within 3 months before screening
- Current insulin therapy or having received insulin within 4 weeks before randomisation
- Treatment with weight reduction medications within 4 weeks before randomisation
